definitions.definition: with a lot of attention or thought, so that you avoid hurting yourself, damaging something or doing something wrong

examples.text: She put the glass down carefully.
We need to **think carefully** about the possible consequences of this decision.
The prime minister's words were **carefully chosen**.
The candidate gave his speech before a **carefully selected** audience.
a **carefully planned** attack on the enemy encampment

definitions.definition: with a lot of attention to detail

examples.text: I urge the council to look carefully at this proposal.
All the evidence should be examined carefully.
The Tribunal then **carefully considered** the evidence which it had heard and read.

definitions.definition: to be very careful about what you do or say

examples.text: The government will have to tread very carefully in handling this issue.
We must tread warily —we don't want to offend anyone.
